title: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
subtitle: The Sacred Abode of Shri Sai Baba in Ahmednagar
overview: Shirdi, located in the Ahmednagar district of Maharashtra, is the sacred home of Shri Sai Baba, one of India’s most loved saints. The temple complex attracts millions of devotees from around the world every year, offering a deeply spiritual experience.

Sai Baba’s teachings of love, faith, and unity continue to inspire devotees across religions. The temple is managed by the Shirdi Sai Baba Sansthan Trust, ensuring a peaceful and well-organized pilgrimage for all visitors.

highlights.title: Samadhi Mandir
highlights.description: The final resting place of Sai Baba, housing his marble idol and samadhi.

highlights.title: Dwarkamai
highlights.description: The mosque where Sai Baba spent most of his life blessing devotees.

geography.intro: Shirdi is a small town located in the Rahata taluka of Ahmednagar district, around 240 km from Mumbai and Pune.

climate.description: Shirdi experiences pleasant winters and hot summers, making October to February the best time to visit.

geography.conclusion: Ideal for spiritual travelers, Shirdi remains serene yet vibrant throughout the year.

activities.title: Attend Aarti Rituals
activities.description: Participate in daily Kakad, Madhyan, Dhoop, and Shej Aartis conducted at the Samadhi Mandir.
info: Morning and evening aartis attract thousands of devotees.
Free prasad is distributed after every session.

activities.title: Visit Lendi Baug
activities.description: A peaceful garden where Sai Baba used to meditate daily.
info: Maintained beautifully with flowers and fountains.
Features the sacred Nanda Deep lamp.

activities.title: Charity Meals (Prasadalaya)
activities.description: Enjoy free vegetarian meals served daily to thousands of devotees.
info: Managed by the Sai Sansthan Trust.
Open to visitors of all faiths.

attractions.title: Dwarkamai Mosque
attractions.description: Historic mosque where Sai Baba lived, offering blessings to all.

attractions.title: Shani Shingnapur Temple
attractions.description: Famous temple dedicated to Lord Shani, about 70 km away from Shirdi.

marineLife.intro: While Shirdi doesn’t have marine life, its spiritual energy nourishes the soul of every devotee.

items.title: Faith and Devotion
items.description: Sai Baba’s message emphasizes love and compassion across all religions.

items.title: Harmony and Peace
items.description: The temple represents unity among people of all faiths.

conclusion: Sai Baba’s teachings continue to inspire millions across the world.
Visiting Shirdi offers peace, faith, and a divine connection.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Shirdi International Airport (14 km) connects major cities like Mumbai, Delhi, and Hyderabad.
Taxis and buses are available from the airport to the temple complex.

howToReach.title: By Train & Road
details: Sainagar Shirdi Railway Station connects to Mumbai, Pune, and Manmad.
Regular buses and private cabs operate from Nashik (90 km), Pune (185 km), and Mumbai (240 km).

bookingTips.description: Book darshan slots online in advance during festival seasons.
Morning hours are less crowded compared to weekends and holidays.
Footwear must be removed before entering the temple premises.
